_header: In May when Flora the fresh lusty queen
Note: For another Envoy cf. 4091; for extract occurring separately cf. 6245
Title(s): The Complaint of the Black Knight (Lydgate)
Subjects: May, poems of; complaints, lovers’; envoys; love, vicissitudes of
_description: John Lydgate, The Complaint of the Black Knight — 665 lines in rhyme royal stanzas and Envoy of two 8-line stanzas

BodDig181.First Lines:
IN May whanne fflora the lusty QueneThe soill hath cladde in grene
                    rede and whight…
BodDig181.Last Lines:
…Exiled be that I may not atteynResoun to ffynde of myn
                    aduersite

Bod638.First Lines:
…So doth this god with his sharp floneThe trew sleith &
                    letith the fals gone…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…Exiled be that I may not atteyneRecure to fynde of myne
                    aduersyte
Bod638.Attributed Title:
[The Complaynte] Of a louers lyfe (f. 1; RT); Explicit the Compleynt
                    of a loveres life (f. 4v)
Bod638.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Bodley 638: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1982.

BodArcSelB24.First Lines:
In Maye quhan fflora the fresche Lusty queneThe suyl hath cladde In
                    rede quhite grene aricht…
BodArcSelB24.Last Lines:
…Exiled ben þat I may nocht atteyneRecouer to fynd of myn
                    aduersitee
BodArcSelB24.Attributed Author:
here endith the maying and disport of Chaucere (f.
                    129v)
BodArcSelB24.Attributed Title:
here endith the maying and disport of Chaucere (f.
                    129v)
BodArcSelB24.Facsimiles:

             Chaucer, Works. Bodleian Library MS Arch Selden B.24: Facsimile
                Edition.
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1995.

BodFair16.First Lines:
In May when fflora the fressh lusty quenethe soyle hath clad in
                    grene rede and white…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…exiled be that I may not ateynerecure to fynde of hym
                    aduersite

BodTan346.First Lines:
In may when flora the fressh lusty queneThe soyl hath clad in red
                    grene and white…
BodTan346.Last Lines:
…Exiled be that I may noghte attayneRecure to fynde Of myn
                    aduersite

CamMagPep2006.First Lines:
[I]n may quhen flora the fresche lusty queneThe soille hadde cladde
                    in grene redde & whyt…
CamMagPep2006.Last Lines:
…Exilet be þat I may not attaynRecure to fynd of my
                    aduersite

BLAdd16165.First Lines:
Yn may whanne flourra þe freshe lusty qweneþe soyle
                    haþe cladde in grene whit and red…
BLAdd16165.Last Lines:
…Exyled beon þat I may not atteyneRekoner to fynde of
                    myne aduersite
BLAdd16165.Attributed Title:
And here filowyng begynneþe a Right lusty amoerous balade made in wyse
                    of complaynt of a Right worshipfull knyght þat truly euer serued his lady
                    enduryng grete disese by fals envye and malebouche made by Lydegate (f.
                    190)

Asloan.First Lines:
IN May quhen flora þe fresche lusty qweneThe sule has clad in
                    reid quhyte grene aricht…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…Exild bene þat I may not atteyneRecovir to fynd of myne
                    aduirsite
Asloan.Attributed Title:
Heir begynnis þe mayng and disport of Chauceir (f. 293); Heir endis
                    þe mayng and disport of Chaucer per m. Jo. Asloan (f.
                    300v)
